artist: William Gray Purcell George Grant Elmslie Mosaic Art Shops (E.L. Sharretts)
description: from the back porch of the Purcell-Cutts House; a reproduction of this window is now on view in the back porch of the Purcell-Cutts House
text: Elmslie incorporated circle and V motifs into many of his designs. The look of this light fixture complements the rectangles and squares of the windows in the Purcell-Cutts house. It was made for the back porch and was mounted like it is here, below a recessed light well holding a single bulb. A reproduction has replaced it on the porch, but an identical fixture remains in the entrance hall of the house.
title: Ceiling light fixture
